title: Ticket #4593: Use Miron probes for DC runtime statistics
description: The DC statistics that keep track of the amount of time spent at various things should optionally be full Miron style probes with min/max/avg/std as well as the current count & accumulated runtime.
remarks:
2014-Nov-12 14:58:05 by tannenba:
Changing status of this ticket from docpending back to active, as beta testing in CHTC shows it is broken.

I attached below a schedd classad from submit machine e142.chtc with full statistics from a schedd running version 8.3.2 release candidate for almost 7 days in the cms global test pool. Note from this ad we see: 

   CondorVersion = "$CondorVersion: 8.3.2 Nov 03 2014 BuildID: 280257 $"
   MonitorSelfAge = 591032

However, there are many statistics that claim impossibly long Runtime values, i.e. much longer than the daemon has been alive! Just a couple of examples grepping from the schedd classad attached to this ticket: 

  C:\utils>grep Reschedule e142
  DCTimer_SchedulersendRescheduleRuntimeMin = 1412964464.788676
  DCTimer_SchedulersendRescheduleRuntimeMax = 1412964464.788676
  DCTimer_SchedulersendRescheduleRuntimeAvg = 1412964464.788676
  DCTimer_SchedulersendRescheduleRuntime = 1412964464.788676
  DCTimer_SchedulersendReschedule = 1
  DCTimer_SchedulersendRescheduleRuntimeStd = 1412964464.788676


  C:\utils>grep DaemonCorerefreshDNS e142
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNSRuntime = 28259289106.17169
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNSRuntimeStd = 0.0
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNSRuntimeAvg = 1412964455.308585
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNSRuntimeMin = 1412964433.891749
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNSRuntimeMax = 1412964476.704736
  DCTimer_DaemonCorerefreshDNS = 20

I think the bug with these crazy Runtime stat values regressed with the commit in this ticket, since the Runtime values seemed sane in v8.3.1.

2014-Nov-17 14:50:40 by tannenba:
Also we are now getting ridiculous RecentDaemonCoreDutyCycle numbers with 8.3.2 rc1. We are getting numbers like 20 Giga %. Guessing this regression is also related to the patches made for this ticket.
attachments:
